short_summary: Wharf reconstruction in Parker's Cove, Nova Scotia
description: The procurement requires construction services to demolish and repair sections of a wharf in Parker’s Cove, Nova Scotia. The work includes: the demolition of an existing timber piled wharf structure and replacing it with a new steel piled wharf structure with concrete deck. Encapsulating an existing marginal timber structure in a new steel pile structure. Removing the timber decking from an existing timber crib structure, raising it by one meter and installing a new concrete deck.

### ITT – Wharf Reconstruction – Parker’s Cove
[Nothing has changed. The title title remains the same.]

### Work Description:
Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC), on behalf of the Department of Fisheries and Oceans, invites proposals for the reconstruction of a wharf in Parker’s Cove, Nova Scotia.

The project includes the demolition of an existing timber piled wharf structure and its replacement with a new steel piled wharf structure with a concrete deck. The scope also encompasses encapsulating an existing marginal timber structure in a new steel pile structure, removing timber decking from an existing timber crib structure, raising it by one meter, and installing a new concrete deck. The total work duration shall not exceed 72 weeks from Award.

An estimated budget of $5,000,000 up to $20,000,000 is anticipated for this procurement.

### Eligibility:
The following firms have been prequalified to participate in this tender:

*   B. Spicer Construction Ltd.
*   Dexter Construction Company Ltd.
*   Greenfield Construction Ltd.
*   Leslie & Benn Contracting Ltd.
*   McNally Construction Inc.
*   R.J.G. Construction Limited
*   Zutphen Contractors

### Inquiry and Documentation:
All inquiries and questions of a technical and contractual nature should be directed to Richard Parsons, Contracting Authority at:
richard.parsons@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

Note that the closing deadline for proposals has not changed and will close on 2022-11-01T 14:00:00. After this time, proposals will no longer be accepted.



### About the Tender Opportunity
The tender is issued through Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) and is published under the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA). The procurement category is classified as Goods and Services (CNST) and the selection criteria will be based on the lowest price. The tendering method is competitive-selective tendering.
